intro: Schlagintweitia huteri subsp. huteri, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb with succulent, fleshy leaves that help it store water in its native habitat. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, hairy fruits that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to high temperatures and low rainfall. Its botanical features make it well-suited for survival in harsh, dry environments.
